com.autogarcon.android

Class ThumbnailManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.autogarcon.android.ThumbnailManager

  • public class ThumbnailManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages the thumbnails that will be temporarily stored on the system as we scroll through the menu.
    Author:
    Tim Callies

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void getImage(java.lang.String url, android.widget.ImageView image)
      Pass in an ImageView, along with the URL, and the thumbnail manager will make an HTTP request and lazily update the ImageView as soon as it gets a response.
      static ThumbnailManager getInstance()
      Singleton constructor
      void getTemporaryImage(java.lang.String url, android.widget.ImageView image)
      Pass in an ImageView, along with the URL, and the thumbnail manager will make an HTTP request and lazily update the ImageView as soon as it gets a response.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ThumbnailManager getInstance()
        Singleton constructor
        Returns:
        The singleton instance of the class. Author: Tim Callies

      • getImage

        public void getImage(java.lang.String url,
                     android.widget.ImageView image)
        Pass in an ImageView, along with the URL, and the thumbnail manager will make an HTTP request and lazily update the ImageView as soon as it gets a response. The image will be stored, so it can be accessed in the future without needing an HTTP request
        Parameters:
        url - The URL where the image exists.
        image - The ImageView that will be updated once the image is recieved Author: Tim Callies

      • getTemporaryImage

        public void getTemporaryImage(java.lang.String url,
                              android.widget.ImageView image)
        Pass in an ImageView, along with the URL, and the thumbnail manager will make an HTTP request and lazily update the ImageView as soon as it gets a response. The image will be stored, so it can be accessed in the future without needing an HTTP request
        Parameters:
        url - The URL where the image exists.
        image - The ImageView that will be updated once the image is recieved Author: Tim Callies
